text: The 1952–53 FAW Welsh Cup is the 66th season of the annual knockout tournament for competitive football teams in Wales. ==Key== League name pointed after clubs name. *CCL - Cheshire County League *FL D1 - Football League First Division *FL D3N - Football League Third Division North *SFL - Southern Football League *WLN - Welsh League North ==Fifth round== Eight winners from the Fourth round and ten new clubs. {| class="wikitable" style="text- align:center" |- !width=50|Tie no !width=250|Home !width=50|Score !width=250|Away |- |1||Wrexham (FL D3N)||3–4||Chester (FL D3N) |} ==Sixth round== Three winners from the Fifth round plus Pwllheli & District. Six clubs get a bye to the Seventh round. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !width=50|Tie no !width=250|Home !width=50|Score !width=250|Away |- |1||Chester (FL D3N)||2–0||Pwllheli & District (WLN) |} ==Seventh round== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !width=50|Tie no !width=250|Home !width=50|Score !width=250|Away |- |1||Chester (FL D3N)||5–0||Lovell's Athletic (SFL) |} ==Semifinal== Chester and Connah's Quay Nomads played at Wrexham. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !width=50|Tie no !width=250|Home !width=50|Score !width=250|Away |- |1||Rhyl (CCL)||1–0||Cardiff City (FL D1) |- |2||Chester (FL D3N)||5–0||Connah's Quay Nomads (WLN) |} ==Final== Final were held at Bangor. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !width=50|Tie no !width=250|Home !width=50|Score !width=250|Away |- |1||Rhyl (CCL)||2–1||Chester (FL D3N) |} ==External links== *The FAW Welsh Cup 1952-53 Wales Cup
title: 1952–53 Welsh Cup
